task_summary: Perceive the T-block and target, approach with a circular end-effector, align, then perform leftward pushes in small increments until the T-block matches the target pose; retreat afterward.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows a red T-shaped block and a drawn T target outline. A robot with a circular end-effector pushes the block to match the target. The behavior detects both entities, approaches above the block, aligns the tool for a leftward push, and executes several short pushes to translate and orient the block into the marked goal area. Fine positioning is achieved by a final micro-push, then the robot retreats to clear the workspace. Observation and control run at 10 Hz, so actions should remain stable between cycles.
preconditions: Blackboard keys initialized for symbols: t_block, target_goal
stepwise_plan: Move above the block and align tool yaw for pushing
Perform repeated short pushes toward the goal (leftward)
Re-detect goal and perform a fine alignment push
Verify placement implicitly by final alignment, then retreat
success_criteria: Block pose overlaps target outline within ~1 cm
End-effector clear of the block after placement
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss: re-detect on next cycle
Insufficient motion: additional push cycles improve translation
Misalignment: re-align yaw and continue micro-pushes
Slip during contact: back off slightly and re-approach
task_long_description.termination: Succeed when condition IsAt(t_block_at_target) would be true or after planned pushes and retreat; otherwise report failure if repeated detections/pushes cannot progress.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear tool–block contact with alignment before pushing.
frame_3.predicts_next: Next frames likely show sustained push toward the goal region.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks whether the block pose matches the goal.
Move above the block with small clearance.
Align tool to contact line on the block.
Align relative to the goal before final nudge.
Final micro-push to settle into the outline.
Back off to clear the workspace.

failure_modes: Block not detected or partially occluded
recovery_strategy: Add more Repeat push cycles if needed
Re-set yaw and re-approach before continuing
Perform fine push with smaller distance
assumptions: Frames show a RED T-block and BLUE target outline, while instruction mentions gray block and green target; we prioritize frame evidence.
Push direction assumed leftward (~180°) based on frames where the block moves toward the central outline.
10 Hz frequency noted but not directly mapped to timeouts; fixed bins used.

expected_success_criteria: Pose overlap within ~1 cm and visually aligned T shape
No additional motion after final push
Arm retreats without disturbing the block
